title: How to get my Medium stories published on Medium publications - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two commons answers to this question: It’s really easy It’s incredibly hard. Somehow, they’re both true.  As you can see, I’m the Editor of a Publication on Medium. A story of mine was curated in Leadership:  and I’ve been published by these publications:  Sonnetry.  Write in The Flow I was accepted by The Brave Writer and The Post-Grad Survival Guide, who continue to reject me - not because I don’t follow their guidelines, but for “not being a fit”, whatever that means. The way to get in is usually fill in a form or respond to their submission guidelines. If they like you they’ll add you as a writer, giving you the ability to submit drafts which they will then review and likely heavily edit and publish or reject. I’ll submit to them maybe one or two more times, but probably not more than that. I’m not desperate to get into publications anymore, and here’s why: Everyone says getting into the big pubs are the key to getting curated - but there’s no evidence to suggest thatEveryone says that getting curated is the key to success - but there’s no evidence to suggest that.Doing what everyone else is doing is part of the problem - there’s plenty of evidence to suggest thatI want to keep control of what I write and I lose that when I submit - plenty of evidence for thatAs far as I can tell, publications are old hat. It’s 2020 now. We’ve gotta write and build our own following, not someone else’s Of course, you could always create your own pub.
Here is a post with detailed instructions: How to Get Published in Publications: The Beginner’s Guide to Medium #1
